intro: Eriope latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf eriope, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish to brownish flowers. Native to South Africa, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is often used in rock gardens and as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance. The plant's structure and growth habit make it suitable for xeriscaping in arid regions.
